titleStmt.title: [Letter] 1824 Dec. 31, Jackson, Madison County, Ten[nessee] [to] Postmaster of Jackson County, Ten[nessee] / William Armour, et al. : a machine readable transcription of an image
titleStmt.author: Armour, William

publicationStmt.publisher: University of Tennessee Special Collections Library

availability.p: This work is the property of the Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, TN. It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text. For all other use contact the Tennessee State Library and Archives, 403 Seventh Avenue North, Nashville, TN 37243-0312. (615) 741-2764.

bibl.title: [Letter] 1824 Dec. 31, Jackson, Madison County, Ten[nessee] [to] Postmaster of Jackson County, Ten[nessee] / William Armour, et al.
bibl.author: Armour, William
bibl.note: This document is a letter written by William Armour, et al. to the Postmaster of Jackson County, Tennessee, dated December 31, 1824. In the letter, Armour & Lake request that any letters sent to them in Jackson County be forwarded to them in Jackson, Madison County, Tennessee.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

div.p: our friend Mr Norofolk of your county informs us that he has seen a letter a letter in your office for us, forwarded there instead of this place by mistake; as you are well aware of the difficulties that may arise to us from such mistakes, we beg most earnestly you will please pay particular attention to this circumstance; and forward them or it to us — and if you have forwarded any to the general office ⁁ of ours inform us and we will write to the postmaster general —

closer.add:
any letters for
William Armour
Henry Lake
or
Robert Lake
please forward here }

add.place: through left side of address, upside down

closer.add:
I wrote to Post
Master General
of 18 Jnry January 1825
requesting the letters
to be forwarded
Law 2nd March 1825

Armour & Lake's
Letter of 31 Decr. December
1824
